CatDescriptText: Mrs. Alma Tomberlin Chandler, 511 Herron Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?"  Answer reads: "I think that the NAACP, through its militant stand has done pretty well. But I don't think that we will get too far through just talk alone.  The gains will have to come through militant action."
TitMainTitle: Alma Tomberlin Chandler wearing large rhinestone brooch and fur stole, standing in front of column with pedestrians in background, Downtown
